description: Details pursuant to Conditions 5 (Construction Management Plan), 16 (Canal Risk Assessment and Method Statement) and partial approval of condition 24(i) (Contamination) of planning permission ref. 39207/APP/2020/2188, dated 24-06-2021, for the redevelopment of the site to provide two industrial units providing industrial floorspace (Use Class B1c/B2/B8) and ancillary offices together with associated parking, access arrangements, landscaping and infrastructure.
application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: Conditions discharged by this decision: 5, 16 and 24(i).
Prior to commencement conditions remaining to be discharged: 14.
Prior to above ground works conditions remaining to be discharged: 8.
Prior to occupation conditions remaining to be discharged: 11, 15, 17, 19, 23 and 24(ii)-(iv).

The Applicant is advised that the details submitted pursuant to Condition 24 are sufficient to allow a partial discharge of this condition, relating to parts (i)(a) and (i)(b) only. Consequently, details to satisfy parts (ii), (iii) and (iv) of Condition 24 are still required to be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, either on completion of the verification works or prior to first occupation.

Notwithstanding the inclusion of the 'Canal Interface Improvement Concept Plan' within the Construction Phase Plan (Rev. 3) (08-11-22), these details do not form of the approved set of documents and are included for indicative purposes only. The inclusion of the Canal Interface Improvement Concept Plan also does not override the need for the applicant to obtain written consent from the Canal & River Trust before any of these measures are implemented.

The applicant is advised to contact Patrick McElroy, Works Engineer on 07867 537622 or email:Patrick.mcelroy@canalrivertrust.org.uk to discuss the implementation of these details further and in order to ensure that any necessary consents are obtained and the works comply with the Trust's Code of Practice.
